metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1184 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in fs/ext4/namei.c:dx_insert_block() in the Linux kernelâ€™s filesystem sub-component. This flaw allows a local attacker with a user privilege to cause a denial of service. It was discovered that the ext4 file system implementation in the Linux kernel contained a use-after-free vulnerability. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious ext4 file system image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-lowlatency - 4.4.0-242.276
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1158-aws - 4.4.0-1158.173
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1159.172~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> not clear if the first two commits are related to this CVE or are some other issue. last three commits are per suse bug; 61a1d87a324a ("ext4: fix check for block being out of directory size") is a fix for 65f8ea4cd57d ("ext4: check if directory block is within i_size")

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-242.276').

linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.172~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1153.170~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
